courseDescription: Covers the electrical properties of cells and tissues as well as the use of electrical and magnetic signals and stimuli in the diagnosis and treatment of disease. Typical topics to be covered include basic cell physiology, endogenous electric fields in the body, electrocardiography, cardiac pacing, defibrillation, electrotherapy, electroporation, and electrotherapy in wound healing. In addition, ultrashort electrical pulses for intracellular manipulation and the application of plasmas to biological systems will be covered.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding electrical properties of cells and tissues
Familiarity with cardiac pacing and defibrillation
Application of ultrashort electrical pulses for intracellular manipulation
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing endogenous electric fields in the body
Problem-solving in the diagnosis and treatment of diseases using electrical and magnetic signals
Critical evaluation of different electrotherapy approaches

courseDescription: Covers the electrical properties of cells and tissues as well as the use of electrical and magnetic signals and stimuli in the diagnosis and treatment of disease. Typical topics to be covered include basic cell physiology, endogenous electric fields in the body, electrocardiography, cardiac pacing, defibrillation, electrotherapy, electroporation, and electrotherapy in wound healing. In addition, ultrashort electrical pulses for intracellular manipulation and the application of plasmas to biological systems will be covered.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding electrical properties of cells and tissues
Utilizing ultrashort electrical pulses for intracellular manipulation
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Explaining complex bioelectric concepts to non-experts
Collaborating with healthcare professionals on treatment plans
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing endogenous electric fields in the body
Troubleshooting issues with cardiac pacing devices
Evaluating the effectiveness of electroporation techniques
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing research projects related to bioelectrics
Leading a team in conducting experiments on electrical stimuli in disease diagnosis

courseDescription: Bioelectrics is a new field encompassing both the science and technology of applying electrical stimuli to biological systems. This course covers the pulsed power technology that is required to generate electrical stimuli as well as the biological responses they evoke in cells and tissues. Particular emphasis is placed on the medical applications of bioelectrics, including tumor ablation, gene electrotransfer, wound healing, decontamination with cold plasma, and treatment of cardiac arrhythmias.

This course will give an overview of the structure and dynamics of biomembranes, the ion channels that are embedded in them, and the electrical properties of biomembranes. Topics include molecular dynamics modeling of biomembranes, membrane damage and repair, ion channel dynamics and their experimental assessment using patch clamping, and excitability in neurons and cardiomyocytes.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data interpretation in ion channel dynamics
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Problem-solving in membrane damage and repair
Analytical skills in assessing ion channel dynamics

courseDescription: This course can be taken either as an attendee or as a presenter. Attendees will receive a pass/fail grade based on whether they satisfy the attendance requirements. Presenters will receive a letter grade for their presentation from a committee of faculty in the audience.
